refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A plain ini-style text file that encodes configuration of a devlink object, used by systemd-devlinkd8. See systemd.syntax7 for a general description of the syntax.

The main devlink object configuration file must have the extension .devlink; other extensions are ignored. Devlink objects are configured as soon as systemd-devlinkd is started if possible. In case they are not present at start, they are configured as they appear one by one.

The .devlink files are read from the files located in the system devlink directory /usr/lib/systemd/devlink and /usr/local/lib/systemd/devlink, the volatile runtime devlink directory /run/systemd/devlink and the local administration devlink directory /etc/systemd/devlink. All configuration files are collectively sorted and processed in alphanumeric order, regardless of the directories in which they live. However, files with identical filenames replace each other. Files in /etc/ have the highest priority, files in /run/ take precedence over files with the same name in /usr/lib/. This can be used to override a system-supplied configuration file with a local file if needed. As a special case, an empty file (file size 0) or symlink with the same name pointing to /dev/null disables the configuration file entirely (it is "masked").

Along with the devlink file foo.devlink, a "drop-in" directory foo.devlink.d/ may exist. All files with the suffix .conf from this directory will be merged in the alphanumeric order and parsed after the main file itself has been parsed. This is useful to alter or add configuration settings, without having to modify the main configuration file. Each drop-in file must have appropriate section headers.

In addition to /etc/systemd/devlink, drop-in .d directories can be placed in /usr/lib/systemd/devlink or /run/systemd/devlink directories. Drop-in files in /etc/ take precedence over those in /run/ which in turn take precedence over those in /usr/lib/. Drop-in files under any of these directories take precedence over the main devlink file wherever located. (Of course, since /run/ is temporary and /usr/lib/ is for vendors, it is unlikely drop-ins should be used in either of those places.)

refsect1.title: [Match] Section Options
refsect1.para: The [Match] section allows to specify keys upon which the kernel devlink objects are matched. All specified keys have to match. The [Match] section accepts the following keys:

listitem.para: The devlink object kind. This setting is compulsory. See the Supported devlink object kinds section for the valid options.
